item.title: 美国电力行业能否满足人工智能对能源的巨大需求？
item.description:
由于人工智能的发展，全国各地的数据中心如雨后春笋般涌现。但是，所有这些能源使用所带来的气候代价非常高昂。【原文：

Thanks to AI, data centers are popping up across the country. But the climate price for all this energy use is steep.

】

item.title: 法官暗示德国电网运营商将输掉利率之争
item.description: 德国的能源网络运营商在争取提高国内电网投资的规定股本回报率的斗争中面临打击，因为德国最高民事法庭表示，它可能会站在监管这些费率的机构一边。【原文：Germany’s energy network operators are facing a blow in their fight to increase the regulated return on equity for grid investments in the country, after the nation’s top civil court indicated it’s likely to side with the agency regulating these rates.】

item.title: 从毛里求斯到莫桑比克，"奇多 "气旋造成死亡和破坏
item.description: 在印度洋西南部的一连串岛屿上，救援人员正在争分夺秒地抢救生命，修复热带气旋 "千岛湖 "造成的破坏。【原文：Rescue workers are racing to save lives and repair damage wrought by Tropical Cyclone Chido in a string of islands across the southwestern Indian Ocean.】

item.title: Broadcom 的 "Nvidia 时刻 "已经到来。现在它需要交付
item.description: 博通公司（Broadcom Inc. ）在上周财报发布后的大涨让人不禁想起 2023 年英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.这家芯片制造商现在需要证明，它能继续成为人工智能时代的另一个巨头。【原文：Broadcom Inc.’s massive rally after last week’s earnings report is reminiscent of when Nvidia Corp. shares first started to take off back in 2023. The chipmaker now needs to prove it can follow through to become another giant of the artificial intelligence era.】

item.title: 瑞士议会批准禁止真主党的提案
item.description: 瑞士议会批准了一项禁止黎巴嫩民兵组织真主党的提案，称其为准军事恐怖组织。【原文：Switzerland’s parliament approved a proposal to ban Lebanese militia group Hezbollah, describing it as a paramilitary terrorist organization.】

item.title: 土耳其 Sahenk 公司为伊斯坦布尔港签署 11 亿美元债务重组协议
item.description: 土耳其大亨费里特-萨亨克（Ferit Sahenk）的 Dogus 集团已与债权人签署协议，将重组与伊斯坦布尔旗舰邮轮港口和购物中心项目相关的超过 10.2 亿欧元（11 亿美元）的债务。【原文：Turkish tycoon Ferit Sahenk’s Dogus Group has signed a deal with creditors to restructure over €1.02 billion ($1.1 billion) in debt tied to its flagship Istanbul cruise port and shopping center project.】

item.title: 土耳其市场监察机构为股票限制和高速交易辩护
item.description: 土耳其最高市场监管机构驳斥了将取消大流行病时期交易限制的猜测，称这些措施对市场稳定至关重要。【原文：Turkey’s top market regulator dismissed speculation that pandemic-era trading limits will be lifted, calling the measures vital for market stability.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡经济增长 5.5%，债务重组接近尾声
item.description: 斯里兰卡上一季度经济增长了 5.5%，这提振了人们的情绪，因为该国正在寻求完成债务重组，这对保持国际货币基金组织的援助畅通至关重要。【原文：Sri Lanka’s economy grew 5.5% last quarter, boosting sentiment as the nation looks to finalize debt restructuring that’s crucial to keep the International Monetary Fund’s aid flowing.】

item.title: 加密货币在 11 月大选中如愿以偿。现在怎么办？
item.description:
该行业现在有能力削弱可能保护消费者免受下一次加密货币崩盘影响的金融规则。【原文：

The industry is now in a position to weaken financial rules that might protect consumers from the next crypto crash.

】

item.title: 彭博社民意调查显示瑞典经济明年增长乏力
item.description: 彭博社的一项调查显示，瑞典停滞不前的经济在 2025 年的扩张速度可能会略低于此前的预期。【原文：Sweden’s stagnant economy is likely to expand somewhat less in 2025 than previously expected, according to a Bloomberg survey.】

item.title: 波兰电力公司 Tauron 计划 2030 年退出煤炭行业，资本支出 250 亿美元
item.description: 随着这个欧盟最依赖煤炭的国家加快能源转型，波兰第二大电力公司 Tauron Polska Energia SA 谋求在本十年末避开燃煤机组。【原文：Poland’s second-biggest power utility Tauron Polska Energia SA seeks to shun its coal-fired units by the end of this decade as the European Union’s most coal-reliant country speeds up energy transition.】

item.title: 希望通过首次公开募股套现的 PE 公司酝酿创造性的债务解决方案
item.description: 收购公司正计划在 2025 年从一系列欧洲投资组合公司中套现，将资金返还给客户。但有一个问题：股市投资者不希望随之而来的债务堆积。【原文：Buyout firms are planning to cash out from a string of European portfolio companies in 2025 to return money to clients. There’s just one catch — stock market investors don’t want the debt piles that can come with them.】

item.title: 迪拜房地产巨头 Emaar 的股价攀升至 2008 年以来最高点
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国最大的上市房地产公司 Emaar Properties PJSC 升至近 17 年来的最高水平，因为它在提高股息支付后延续了涨势。【原文：Emaar Properties PJSC, the largest listed real estate firm in the United Arab Emirates, rose to the highest level in nearly 17 years as it extends a rally after boosting dividend payouts.】

item.title: 德国企业前景在经济不确定性中下滑
item.description: 德国 12 月商业预期下滑，凸显了欧洲第一大经济体面临的挑战，因为临时大选可能会带来政府更迭。【原文：German business expectations sank in December, highlighting the challenges for Europe’s top economy with snap elections likely to bring a change of government.】

item.title: 芬兰银行因不确定性影响下调经济展望
item.description: 北欧国家中央银行表示，芬兰经济明年的扩张速度将低于此前的预测，原因是全球经济的不确定性和国内需求不振。【原文：Finnish economy will expand less next year than previously forecast, the Nordic country’s central bank said, citing uncertainty in the global economy and tepid domestic demand.】

item.title: 德国削减联邦债务销售额 13% 至 2025 年达到 3800 亿欧元
item.description: 德国明年将把联邦债务销售额减少 13%，因为尽管经济萎靡不振，政府也面临着支持乌克兰抵御俄罗斯的压力，但德国政府仍将缩减债务销售额。【原文：Germany will reduce federal debt sales by 13% next year as the government scales back despite a sputtering economy and pressure to support Ukraine’s defense against Russia.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长雷恩认为通胀稳定后利率方向明确
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员奥利-雷恩（Olli Rehn）表示，随着通胀率开始稳定在 2% 的目标附近，欧洲中央银行的利率将继续走低。【原文：European Central Bank interest rates will continue to head lower as inflation starts to stabilize around the 2% goal, according to its Governing Council member Olli Rehn.】

item.title: GlobalWafers 公司获得 4.06 亿美元美国芯片法案奖金
item.description: GlobalWafers Co.是一家台湾芯片制造用硅晶片制造商，该公司已敲定将从美国芯片与科学法案（US Chips and Science Act）中获得高达 4.06 亿美元的奖励，用于帮助在得克萨斯州和密苏里州建厂。【原文：GlobalWafers Co., a Taiwanese maker of silicon wafers used in chip manufacturing, finalized a deal to receive as much as $406 million in awards from the US Chips and Science Act to help build factories in Texas and Missouri.】

item.title: 印度银行业流动性赤字创六个月来新高
item.description: 印度银行系统的流动性赤字创下了近六个月来的新高，原因是公司预付税款以及央行可能出售美元以抑制卢比波动。【原文：The liquidity deficit in the Indian banking system hit the highest in nearly six months on advance tax payments by companies and likely dollar sales by the central bank to curb rupee volatility.】

item.title: 迪拜对冲基金在 7 亿美元首次亮相前失去重要交易员
item.description: 迪拜麦哲伦资本公司（Magellan Capital）的一名投资组合经理在该对冲基金计划发行 7 亿美元之前几个月离职，该基金将跻身阿拉伯联合酋长国规模最大的首次发行基金之列。【原文：A portfolio manager at Dubai’s Magellan Capital has departed months ahead of the hedge fund’s planned $700 million launch, which is set to rank among the largest debuts in the United Arab Emirates.】

item.title: 展望资本基金两周内第二次被降至 "绩差 "评级
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）将这家规模达 76 亿美元的私人信贷基金的评级下调至 Ba1，即一步跨入垃圾级行列。【原文：Prospect Capital Corp. received its second downgrade in as many weeks, as Moody’s Ratings lowered its assessment of the $7.6 billion private credit fund to Ba1, or one step into junk territory.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚中央银行总部遭反贪局突袭
item.description: 印度尼西亚反贪局突袭了位于雅加达的中央银行总行，这是对货币当局使用企业社会责任基金的持续调查的一部分。【原文：Indonesia’s anti-graft agency raided the main office of the central bank in Jakarta as part of an ongoing probe into the monetary authority’s use of corporate social responsibility funds.】

item.title: 印度考虑放宽对另类投资基金的监管
item.description: 印度市场监管机构的一位高级官员表示，在一系列旨在遏制该行业违规行为的措施似乎奏效之后，印度市场监管机构可能会放宽对规模达 530 亿美元的另类投资基金行业的部分监管规定。【原文：India’s market regulator may relax some of the regulations governing the $53 billion alternative investment funds sector, after a series of measures aimed at curbing the industry’s erring ways seemed to have worked, a top official said.】

item.title: 尽管降息，瑞士政府仍预计明年通胀率将下降
item.description: 瑞士政府下调了对消费价格的预测，这支持了人们的预期，即瑞士央行上周的大幅降息不足以阻止消费价格回落。【原文：Switzerland’s government slashed its forecast for consumer prices, supporting expectations that the central bank’s out-sized interest-rate cut last week won’t be enough to stop them subsiding.】

item.title: 日本与特朗普建立关系，即使陷入困境的总理仍留在国内
item.description: 日本正在向美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表达继续保持牢固关系的意愿，即使其不受欢迎的首相仍留在国内处理不稳定的政治局势。【原文：Japan is getting its pitch across to US President-elect Donald Trump for continued strong relations, even as its unpopular prime minister stays home to deal with an unstable political situation.】

item.title: 英国工资飙升后交易员认为英国央行降息次数将减少
item.description: 在截至 10 月份的三个月中，英国工资增长速度超过预期，货币市场大幅解除了对英国降息的押注。【原文：Money markets unwound bets on UK interest rate cuts sharply after UK wage growth accelerated more than forecast in the three months through October.】

item.title: 中国人工智能独角兽知普融资 4.12 亿美元，以增强火力
item.description: 总部位于北京的智普公司（Zhipu）再次融资 30 亿元人民币（4.12 亿美元），为其人工智能开发工作提供动力。【原文：Beijing-based Zhipu raised a further 3 billion yuan ($412 million) to power its artificial intelligence development efforts.】

item.title: 津巴布韦未能向被征用土地的白人农民支付报酬
item.description: 津巴布韦的白人商业种植者说，政府没有向征用其土地的农民支付 3.31 亿美元补偿中的一部分，但却补偿了其他未参与交易的农民。【原文：White commercial growers in Zimbabwe said that the government has failed to pay part of $331 million in compensation to farmers for expropriating their land but reimbursed others who weren’t part of the deal.】

item.title: 印度向议会提交 "一个国家，一次选举 "法案
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）领导的政府向议会提交了一份在全国范围内同时举行选举的立法草案，为改变世界上最大民主国家的选举格局迈出了新的一步。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government has introduced a draft legislation in the parliament to hold simultaneous elections across the country, taking another step in an attempt to alter the electoral landscape in the world’s biggest democracy.】

item.title: 印度企业通过出售股票从大买家处融资 160 亿美元
item.description: 2024 年，印度公司通过向大型投资者出售股票筹集了破纪录的 160 亿美元，尽管出现了典型的季节性低迷，但股票发行依然强劲。【原文：Indian companies have raised a record-breaking $16 billion via share sales to large investors in 2024, with offerings remaining robust despite the typical seasonal lull.】
